body_html:
I can confirm official tensorflow docker image works correctly for both public and private buckets.

The below Dockerfile is the smallest repro of the issue. Are there additional dependencies I need to install? Does the pip installation ship with the s3 filesystem?

docker build -t tf-15159:latest .
docker run --rm -it tf-15159:latest

FROM centos:7

RUN yum -y update && \
    yum -y install epel-release && \
    yum -y install python2-pip

RUN pip install 'tensorflow == 1.4.0'

CMD python -c "from tensorflow.python.lib.io import file_io; file_io.stat('s3://datasets.elasticmapreduce/ngrams/books/20090715/eng-1M/1gram/data')"

body:
I can confirm official tensorflow docker image works correctly for both public and private buckets. 

The below Dockerfile is the smallest repro of the issue. Are there additional dependencies I need to install? Does the pip installation ship with the s3 filesystem? 

```
docker build -t tf-15159:latest .
docker run --rm -it tf-15159:latest
```

```
FROM centos:7

RUN yum -y update && \
    yum -y install epel-release && \
    yum -y install python2-pip

RUN pip install 'tensorflow == 1.4.0'

CMD python -c "from tensorflow.python.lib.io import file_io; file_io.stat('s3://datasets.elasticmapreduce/ngrams/books/20090715/eng-1M/1gram/data')"
```
